Dear Christy Shillings:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
P.O. BOX 30650 • LANSING, MICHIGAN 48909
www.michigan.gov • (517) 335-1980

Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact area manager, Rorie Dodge-Pifer, at 517-899-6024.
Sincerely,
Vivian D Malleck, Licensing Consultant

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code Youth restraint; pregnant youth; reduction, prevention;
Title prohibited restraints; elimination of restraints.
Rule Code & R 400.4159 (2) The following restraints are strictly prohibited:
Section (e) Restraining youth in a prone position or any restraint that
Description restricts the youth’s airway.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation On the night of 04/01/2024 at 10:05 PM on the second floor, two
youth were fighting. A staff member intervened in the fight. The
staff member put his/her elbow in one of the youth’s neck while
they were on the ground. The staff member slammed the youth.
The youth sustained two large bruises to the left forearm and a
bump on the head under the hair. The youth has other bruises on
the face that were caused by the other youth. This was caught on
videotape.
Investigation Interviews
I interviewed Complainant on 04/03/2024. Complainant did not
have additional information.
I interviewed Youth A at his current placement, Mott Children’s
Residence, on 04/09/2024. Youth A stated Staff Person 1
redirected him to return to his room because he was waking up
the other youths. Youth A stated he refused to return to his room
unless he was given extra chips to eat. Youth A stated Youth B
came out of his room and told Youth A to be quiet and to go back
to his room. Youth A stated he refused and continued to be loud in
the hallway. Youth A stated Youth B came out of his room again
and put Youth A in a headlock for being loud. Youth A stated he
and Youth B fell to the ground and Youth B hit him in the face.
Youth A stated Staff Person 1 intervened and placed his elbow on
the back of Youth A’s neck while Youth A was on the ground on
his stomach. Youth A stated the incident ended when Youth A got
up from the ground and went to his room. Youth A stated he had a
bruise on his forehead by his hairline and on his face that was
caused by Youth B. Youth A stated the bruises on his forearms
may have been from Staff Person 1 or Youth B or from something
else. Youth A was not observed with bruise marks on his forehead
or arms on 04/09/2024. Youth A denied pain to his head and
arms.
2

I interviewed Youth B at Wolverine Center on 04/04/2024 with
Department of Health and Human Service Worker 1 and
Department of Health and Human Service Worker 2. Youth B
stated Youth A banged on his door as he was about to get under
the covers for the night. Youth B stated he opened his room door
and saw Youth A try to open the fire extinguisher box as Staff
Person 4 redirected Youth A not to touch the fire extinguisher.
Youth B stated he told Youth A to move away when Youth A
spoke loudly with Staff Person 1 in the hallway by Youth B’s room.
Youth B stated he put Youth A in a headlock when Youth A did not
move away. Youth B stated Staff Person 1 tried to intervene by
getting between Youth A and Youth B, but Staff Person 1 tripped
and they went to the ground with Youth A beneath Staff Person 1
and Youth B. Youth B stated he got up from the ground and went
to his room. Youth B stated Youth A came to his room door and
threatened to kill him and staff redirected Youth A away from
Youth B’s room door. Youth B stated he was not injured in this
incident. Youth B stated his arm hit Youth A’s eye during the
headlock. Youth B stated he did not see Staff Person 1’s position
with Youth A on the ground or what occurred between Staff
Person 1 and Youth A.
I interviewed Youth C at Wolverine Center on 04/04/2024 with
Department of Health and Human Service Worker 1 and
Department of Health and Human Service Worker 2. Youth C
stated Youth A yelled in the hallway and flicked the hallway light
on and off to prevent youths from sleeping because he wanted
another snack. Youth C stated Youth B came out of his room and
said, “Shut the fuck up” and Youth A said, “No, you shut the fuck
up.” Youth C stated Youth B went back to his room and later came
out and put Youth A in a headlock after Youth A swung at Youth
B. Youth C stated Youth A hit his head on the wall when Youth A
and Youth B fell to the ground with Youth B landing on top of
Youth A. Youth C stated Youth B got up from the ground and
Youth A started to cry. Youth C stated Staff Person 6 intervened
and walked Youth A to his room. Youth C stated he did not see
Youth A and Staff Person 1 interact in this incident.
I interviewed Youth D at Wolverine Center on 04/04/2024 with
Department of Health and Human Service Worker 1 and
Department of Health and Human Service Worker 2. Youth D was
asked to describe Youth A. Youth D stated Youth A makes poor
decisions by saying mean things and name calling youths. Youth
D was unable to provide a specific example or further details.
Youth D stated he did not witness the incident between Youth A,
Youth B, and staff on 04/01/2024 during sleeping hours.
3

I interviewed Staff Person 1 at Wolverine Center on 04/12/2024
with another Department of Health and Human Service Worker.
Staff Person 1 stated Youth A caused a disturbance for at least 30
minutes by banging on youth room doors and turning the hallway
lights on and off. Staff Person 1 stated Youth B stepped out of his
room and told Youth A to stop disrupting those trying to sleep and
then returned to his room. Staff Person 1 stated Youth A
continued his disruptive behavior and Youth B stepped out of his
room again and put his hands around Youth A’s neck. Staff
Person 1 stated Youth A and Youth B fell to the ground as Staff
Person 1 tried to separate them. Staff Person 1 stated he leaned
over Youth A, who was on his backside, to help him up. Staff
Person 1 stated Youth A got up from the ground and went to his
room. Staff Person 1 denied placing his arm or elbow on the front
or back of Youth A’s neck.
I interviewed Staff Person 2 at Wolverine Center on 04/12/2024
with another Department of Health and Human Service Worker.
Staff Person 2 stated youths were in their rooms for sleeping
hours except for Youth A, who threatened to keep the youths up if
he did not get more chips. Staff Person 2 stated Youth A yelled
“wake up” as he paced the hallway. Staff Person 2 stated Youth A
stopped in front of Youth B’s room and Youth B asked Youth A to
go to his room and sleep before it was time for school. Staff
Person 2 stated Youth A yelled, “Fuck school!” Staff Person 2
stated Youth A continued to yell and pace in the hallway until
Youth B stepped out of his room to use the bathroom. Staff
Person 2 stated Youth B said something about not getting enough
sleep for school and then Youth A and Youth B engaged in a
physical altercation. Staff Person 2 stated she radioed for
assistance. Staff Person 2 stated Staff Person 1 attempted to
separate Youth A and Youth B, but Youth A broke free from Youth
B and fell to the ground with Staff Person 1 on their sides. Staff
Person 2 stated other staff arrived and she went to check on the
other youths.
I interviewed Staff Person 3 at Wolverine Center on 04/22/2024
with another Department of Health and Human Service Worker.
Staff Person 3 stated he recalled Youth A acted out during
sleeping hours and tried to pull the fire extinguisher out of the
case. Staff Person 3 stated he verbally redirected Youth A away
from the fire extinguisher and Youth A ran to the adjoining
hallway. Staff Person 3 stated he did not witness Youth A and
Youth B’s physical altercation and did not witness Staff Person 1’s
intervention with Youth A.
4

I interviewed Staff Person 4 by phone on 04/22/2024. Staff
Person 4 stated she heard Youth B tell Youth A to quiet down.
Staff Person 4 stated she stepped in to the adjoining hallway to
address another youth and did not witness the physical altercation
between Youth A and Youth B. Staff Person 4 stated she heard a
male staff (identity unknown) direct Youth A to step away. Staff
Person 4 did not have further details.
I interviewed Staff Person 5 by phone on 04/22/2024. Staff
Person 5 stated he responded to an assistance call about Youth A
refusing to step in to his room. Staff Person 5 stated when he
arrived on the unit Youth A told him that Youth B hit him. Staff
Person 5 stated he did not witness Youth A and Youth B’s
physical altercation and Staff Person 1’s intervention in the
incident.
I left voicemail messages for Staff Person 6 on 04/22/2024,
05/03/2024, and 05/06/2024 and did not receive a return call. The
following was obtained from Department of Health and Human
Service Worker 1, who interviewed Staff Person 6 by phone on
04/24/2024. Staff Person 6 stated he walked up the back stairwell
on to the unit and saw Staff Person 1 lying on top of Youth A while
Youth A and Youth B punched each other. Staff Person 6 stated
Staff Person 1 protected Youth A against Youth B’s punches. Staff
Person 6 stated he redirected Youth B twice to step back. Staff
Person 6 stated Youth B froze and then walked away and Staff
Person 1 and Youth A got up from the ground. Staff Person 6
stated he did not know how Youth A and Youth B’s physical
altercation started.
Video Review
04/01/2024 video starting at 10:03 PM was reviewed on
04/12/2024 at Wolverine Center. Video shows Youth A and Youth
B facing each other and talking in the hallway while Staff Person 1
stands against the opposite wall. Youth B stands in front of Youth
A and pushes Youth A in the chest. Youth A steps towards Youth
B and Youth B puts Youth A in a headlock. Staff Person 1 steps
behind Youth A as Youth A and Youth B move to the opposite
side of the hallway. Staff Person 1 stands behind Youth A and
places his hands on Youth A’s arms. Youth A and Staff Person 1
fall to the ground and Youth B falls partially to the ground. A male
staff arrives and guides Youth B away from Youth A and into a
room. Staff Person 1 lays on top of Youth A for approximately 15
seconds as Youth A moves around on the ground on his stomach
and on his side. Another male staff arrives. Youth A gets up from
5

the ground and attempts to enter Youth B’s room, but a male staff
person stands in Youth B’s doorway blocking his path. Another
male staff arrives and stands in front of Youth A blocking his path
to Youth B’s room.
Documentation
• Incident report dated 04/01/2024 at 8:30 PM written by
Staff Person 2 states Youth A wanted another snack and
became disruptive by yelling profanity towards staff,
opening youth room doors, and yelling to keep youths up.
Staff Person 1 tried to break up Youth A and Youth B’s
physical altercation. Staff Person 1 and Youth A fell to the
ground and assistance came.
• Incident report dated 04/01/2024 at 10:00 PM written by
Staff Person 6 states he heard a loud commotion when he
was in the back stairwell. Staff Person 6 entered the unit
and saw Youth A and Youth B in a physical altercation.
Staff Person 1 fell on top of Youth A when Staff Person 1
intervened. Staff Person 1 shielded Youth A from Youth B’s
swings. Staff Person 6 intervened and separated Youth B
from the incident. Staff Person 6 wrote Youth A had
bruising on his forehead and around his eye and would be
evaluated at urgent care.
• Youth A was seen at Michigan Urgent Care on 04/02/2024
for a head injury and pain in his right hand. Youth A was
prescribed acetaminophen for his head injury and an ace
wrap for his right hand.
• Staff Person 1 was hired in 05/2023. Staff Person 1 was
last trained in Nonviolent Crisis Physical Intervention on
12/05/2023. Staff Person 1 is not employed at Wolverine
Center as of 04/12/2024.
Tour
The second-floor at Wolverine Center is shaped like the letter “T”.
This incident occurred at the end of the hallway in the south
corner (right hand side of the letter “T” crossbar). Bedrooms are
on both sides of the hallway.
Analysis The agency is found in non-compliance when Staff Person 1 laid
on top of Youth A with Youth A in a prone position on the ground.
It cannot be determined if Staff Person 1 placed his elbow on the
back of Youth A’s neck. It is not found that Staff Person 1 caused
Youth A’s facial and arm bruises.
Conclusion VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
6

IV. RECOMMENDATION
Based on investigative findings the facility is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the current license status be continued.
